alert.note: Alert for Kent (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 03 at 10:52AM EDT until April 10 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Michigan... Grand River near Comstock Park affecting Kent County. Red Cedar River At East Lansing affecting Ingham County. .Recent heavy rain, combined with several additional rounds of rain over the next few days, will prolong the minor flooding conditions already occurring. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING TO MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Grand River near Comstock Park. * WHEN...From Tuesday morning to Monday evening. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Expect minor flooding of homes along Abrigador Trail. At 13.0 feet, Abrigador Trail is underwater and minor flooding of homes occurs along Abrigador Trail and Willow Drive. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:19 AM EDT Monday the stage was 11.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow morning to a crest of 12.8 feet early Friday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.8 feet on 06/30/2021. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/grr.
